serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract: World Countries 2008 (Generalized) (line) is a polyline theme representing the generalized boundary lines for the countries of the world.
descript.purpose: World Countries 2008 (Generalized) (line) provides the generalized political boundary lines for the world. The generalized political boundary lines improve draw performance and effectiveness at a global level.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:50,000,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States: Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was originally extracted from the ArcWorld Supplement database and then generalized (tolerance unknown) and generalized again to a tolerance of 0.1 decimal degrees. The positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.title: World Administrative Units, 2008

serinfo.issue: 2006 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

citeinfo.othercit: Provides the boundary between Montenegro and Serbia.

citeinfo.title: The World Factbook 2007
citeinfo.othercit: The online Factbook is updated periodically throughout the year.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted geography line work from 2005 World Countries (Generalized). Added attributes BND_TYPE and IN_WATER and coded their values. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Added international boundary line between Serbia and Montenegro using the boundary from 2006 World Administrative Units. Removed an area in the Netherlands where land was in the process of being reclaimed from the sea but was never completed.

enttyp.enttypd: The lines represent the generalized boundary lines for the countries of the world.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

edom.edomvd: The type of boundary is a coastline.
The type of boundary is an international boundary.
The type of boundary is a median line.

attr.attrdef: The indicator that the boundary line is in water.

edom.edomvd: The boundary line is not in water.
The boundary line is in water.
